Patent Information.Patent Title: Use of antimicrobial proteins and peptides for the treatment of otitis media and paranasal sinusitis.
Patent Information.Abstract: The pharmaceutical composition and a method of treatment of infectious diseases, such as otitis media, paranasal sinusitis, labyrinthitis and meningitis are described. The composition comprises EP2E or homologues thereof.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Human beta-defensin 4 (hBD-4, BD-4; Beta-defensin 104; Human, mammals, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus carnosus TM300 (MIC=4.5 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli BL21 (MIC>100 µg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC=4.1 µg/ml).Yeast:Saccharomyces cerevisiae ATCC9763 (MIC>100 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Has antimicrobial activity. Synergistic effects with lysozyme and DEFB103.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: High expression in the testis. Gastric antrum exhibited relatively high levels. A lower expression is observed in uterus and neutrophils thyroid gland, lung, and kidney. No detectable expression in other tissues tested.
Sequence Information.Induction: Antimicrobial activity is decreased when the sodium chloride concentration is increased.

Literature.Title: Human beta-defensin 4 a novel inducible peptide with a specific salt-sensitive spectrum of antimicrobial activity.
Literature.Author: García JR, Krause A, Schulz S, Rodríguez-Jiménez FJ, Klüver E, Adermann K, Forssmann U, Frimpong-Boateng A, Bals R, Forssmann WG.

Literature.Title: Cross-species analysis of the mammalian beta-defensin gene family: presence of syntenic gene clusters and preferential expression in the male reproductive tract.
Literature.Author: Zhang G.,Blecha F.,Sang Y.,Cai Y.,Patil A.A.

Literature.Title: The complexity of selection at the major primate beta-defensin locus.
Literature.Author: Eastwood H.,Kilanowski F.M.,Gautier P.,Maxwell A.,Semple C.A.M.
